inlineContent.text: A 3-element structure that can be used to represent 3D grid coordinates or any other triplet of integers.
It uses integer coordinates and is therefore preferable to
when exact precision is required. Note that the values are limited to 32 bits, and unlike
this cannot be configured with an engine build option. Use integer or
In a boolean context, a Vector3i will evaluate to
. Otherwise, a Vector3i will always evaluate to

abstract.text: A 3D vector using integer coordinates.
Compares two
vectors by first checking if the X value of the left vector is greater than or equal to the X value of the
vector. If the X values are exactly equal, then it repeats this check with the Y values of the two vectors, and then with the Z values. This operator is useful for sorting vectors.
